review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Did you have a positive focus to your thinking yesterday? That put you on The Path!
quote:
"Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is
  living with the results of other people's thinking." - Steve Jobs

step_of_the_day.title:
Strengthening your ability to be present. Being present to support your independence and self-direction
  (Pillar #7)
step_of_the_day.content:
Presence, my seventh pillar of resilience and success, is about an awareness of the moment. If you are going
  to be "response - able" in life, you first must be in the moment to have choice. Whether we use the phrase,
  "monkey brain", or habitual patterns, or, as Steve Jobs refers to "dogma", most of the time we are living
  by the rules and conditioning of others. We have the old voice in our heads - "worry about this", "do it
  this way", "someone will be upset with you", "it's too difficult", "look at what he or she has", "you
  are getting behind", "you should be ...".None of this serves or supports you. It only adds to your stress, dissatisfaction and self-doubt.I have been encouraging you to notice these messages and then to shift into your Healthy Internal Parent
  coming from a place of Love, Compassion, Acceptance, Support and Care. But to do this you need to be present
  - in the moment - to have this awareness to take The Path.

action_step:
Make it your intention to be present in as many moments as possible today. Hold the intention to identify
  old messages in your head and then choose to shift to your healthy internal parent for the healthy and
  correct perspective.
journal_entry: Write about your efforts to notice the old pattern, and to shift into a healthier pattern.
